definitions: To make something visible or known by uncovering it.
To subject someone or something to a risk or harmful situation.
To reveal the true nature of someone or something, especially if it is negative.
To allow light to fall on a photographic film or sensor.
examples: He decided to expose the truth about the scandal.
Do not expose your skin to direct sunlight for too long.
The journalist worked to expose corruption in the government.
The photographer had to expose the film correctly.
